docwise_example.Findings: There is no evidence of pulmonary emboli in the main pulmonary arteries, lobar arteries, or segmental arteries.  There is no evidence of a pericardial effusion.  There is no evidence of pleural effusion.
There is a transverse fracture of the mid shaft of the radius. There is no evidence of a fracture of the ulna. The distal radioulnar joint is intact.
docwise_example.Diagnosis: Transverse fracture of the mid shaft of the radius
docwise_example.Impression: Transverse fracture of the mid shaft of the radius

summary_example.Summary: A 70-year-old male patient presents with urinary frequency, urgency and urgency urinary incontinence, diabetes mellitus, and is prescribed Vesigard, Megatas, Looz syrup, and various diagnostic tests. A 63-year-old male patient presents with ischemic heart disease and is prescribed Cardivas, and various diagnostic tests.

TreatmentDetails.TreatmentDescription: Urinary frequency, urgency and urgency urinary incontinence
